private_information: I may move only disks A, B, C, D, E
agent_1.goal: Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that, together with agent_2, achieves the global goal while respecting Tower of Hanoi rules and my disk move restrictions.

private_information: I may move only disks F, G, H, I, J
agent_2.goal: Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that, together with agent_1, achieves the global goal while respecting Tower of Hanoi rules and my disk move restrictions.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' ordered primitive moves and produce a final PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownward solver that represents the cooperative 2-agent Tower of Hanoi instance. Keep actions of the two agents distinct.

public_information: This is a Tower of Hanoi puzzle with 3 pegs: left, middle, right.
Disks are labeled A through J where A is the smallest and J is the largest.
Initial configuration: left peg top-to-bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle empty; right empty.
Goal configuration: left peg top-to-bottom B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle empty; right peg top-to-bottom A.
Standard Tower of Hanoi rules apply: only one disk can be moved at a time and a larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Two agents cooperate but each agent is restricted to moving a subset of disks: agent_1 may move A,B,C,D,E; agent_2 may move F,G,H,I,J.
Primitive move format required from agents: 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.

primitive_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1 participating in a cooperative Tower of Hanoi solution. You must respect the global rules and your disk-move permissions.
primitive_moves.prompt: Your name is agent_1. Use the public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->agent_1->private_information}. Your goal is {agents->agent_1->goal}. Provide a single ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include moves you are permitted to perform (disks A,B,C,D,E). Each list element must be a single move string. Do not emit PDDL and do not assume additional permissions.

primitive_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2 participating in a cooperative Tower of Hanoi solution. You must respect the global rules and your disk-move permissions.
primitive_moves.prompt: Your name is agent_2. Use the public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Your goal is {agents->agent_2->goal}. Provide a single ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include moves you are permitted to perform (disks F,G,H,I,J). Each list element must be a single move string. Do not emit PDDL and do not assume additional permissions.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Your task is to integrate the primitive move lists produced by the agents and produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem for the cooperative 2-agent Tower of Hanoi instance that can be solved with the FastDownward planner. Keep actions of agent_1 and agent_2 distinct and model agent-specific actions accordingly.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Receive the two agents' ordered primitive move lists: {moves_agent_1} and {moves_agent_2}. Use the public information {environment->public_information} and the agents' private information. Validate that the combined sequence respects Tower of Hanoi rules and agent move permissions. If there are conflicts or illegal moves, adjust the sequence only by reordering or by removing illegal moves and record those adjustments. Then produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that capture the 3-peg Tower of Hanoi with explicit actions for agent_1 and agent_2 (for example, move-agent_1 and move-agent_2 or similar), constraints that prevent larger disks on smaller ones, and an initial and goal state matching the instance. Target the FastDownward solver. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
